news-item.title: NLC workers on token strike today
news-item.text: New Delhi, March 18 -- Workers of state-run Neyveli Lignite Corporation went on a one-day token strike today on the call of trade unions in protest against killing of a former contract employee by a CISF jawan yesterday. "Condemning the shooting incident in which a Central Industrial Security Force jawan killed a former contract workman on March 17, 2014, the Joint Action Council of all the trade unions of the company has called for a one day token strike from 10 PM on March 17, 2014, to 10 PM on March 18, 2014," the company said in a filing to the BSE. The power generation is being maintained, the filing said. The state-run lignite miner has three opencast lignite mines of total capacity of 28.5 million tonnes per annum (MTPA) at Neyveli, Tamil Nadu, and one open cast lignite mine of capacity 2.1 MTPA at Barsingsar, Rajasthan. It also has three thermal power stations with a total installed capacity of 2,490 mega watt (mw) at Neyveli and one thermal power station at Barsingsar, Rajasthan, with an installed capacity of 250 mw.
